title: Showers expected in most places after 1 pm today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most places of the island after 1.00 p.m. today (09), the Department of Meteorology says.

title: SriLankan Cargo secures South Asia’s first IATA Lithium Battery Certification
byline: SriLankan Cargo, the air freight arm of SriLankan Airlines, has become South Asia’s first airline cargo division to secure the prestigious CEIV Lithium Batteries Certification (Center of Excellence for Independent Validators –  Lithium Batteries) from the International Air Transport Association (IATA)

title: Sri Lankan man arrested over death of Brazilian influencer in Japan
byline: A Brazilian influencer and Formula One fan who declared her love for Japan and told her mother she felt completely safe in the country was found dead in suspicious circumstances – just hours before she was due to fly home.

title: LG Polls: Election Comm. sets deadline to submit campaign finance reports
byline: The Election Commission has instructed all candidates who contested the 2925 Local Government (LG) Elections to submit their campaign income and expenditure reports on or before May 28.

title: Helicopter crashes into Maduru Oya Reservoir
byline: UPDATE: All individuals who were onboard the Bell 212 helicopter which crashed into the Maduru Oya Reservoir have been rescued, the Sri Lanka Air Force confirmed.

title: Special train services for long weekend and Vesak festival
byline: Sri Lanka Railways has taken steps to add special train services into operation starting today (May 9) to accommodate increased passenger demand during the long weekend and the state Vesak festival.

title: Sri Lankan President congratulates Pope Leo XIV
byline: Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has congratulated His Holiness Pope Leo XIV on his election as the new leader of the Catholic Church.

title: Helicopter crash: Death toll climbs to six
byline: UPDATE: This brings the death toll from the fatal accident to six, while 6 other armed forces personnel, who sustained injuries in the incident, are currently receiving treatment at the hospital.

title: IPL 2025 suspended indefinitely as India-Pakistan military tensions escalate
byline: The Indian Premier League has been suspended amid mounting security concerns following the military escalation between India and Pakistan, the BCCI sources confirmed to Hindustan Times on Friday.

title: More details revealed on SLAF helicopter crash in Maduru Oya
byline: A Bell 212 helicopter belonging to the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) crashed into the Maduru Oya reservoir this morning (May 9), claiming the lives of six personnel from the Sri Lanka Army and Air Force.

title: Bomb scare at Russian Embassy: German woman arrested and questioned
byline: The Cinnamon Gardens Police have arrested a German national woman in connection with the recent suspicious incident involving a laptop left near the Russian Embassy in Colombo.

title: Dan Priyasad murder: Two suspects identified by witnesses
byline: Two suspects arrested and remanded in connection with the murder of political activist Dan Priyasad have been identified by witnesses during an identification parade held at the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (May 9).

title: ‘Divi Neguma’ officer gets 20 years RI, loses civil rights for soliciting sexual bribe
byline: A ‘Divi Neguma’ development officer has been sentenced to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment by the Colombo High Court for soliciting a sexual bribe from a 30-year-old mother of three in exchange for facilitating a government subsidy for her child’s kidney surgery.

title: Pope Leo XIV celebrates first Mass after historic election as Pope Francis’ successor
byline: Pope Leo XIV, history’s first North American pope, celebrated his first Mass as pontiff on Friday, presiding in the Sistine Chapel with the cardinals who elected him to succeed Pope Francis and follow in his social justice-minded footsteps.

title: Bangladesh to adopt Sri Lankan model for dengue elimination - report
byline: Bangladesh is set to implement the Sri Lankan model to combat and eliminate dengue, according to Bangladeshi media reports.

title: All liquor stores, meat shops, casinos closed 3 days for Vesak
byline: The Ministry of Public Administration and Home Affairs announced that all meat selling outlets, including supermarket counters, slaughter houses, betting centres, casinos and liquor serving or selling outlets have been informed to remain closed on May 12, 13 and 14.

title: 52 fatalities from 79 shooting incidents reported within 7 months: Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala revealed that 79 shooting incidents have occurred in the country within the past 7 months, resulting in 52 fatalities and injuries to 35 individuals.

title: Teacher accused of molesting Kotahena schoolgirl sent on compulsory leave
byline: The Ministry of Education says that the teacher allegedly involved in the incident of molesting the schoolgirl from Kotahena has been sent on compulsory leave after receiving a police ‘B report’.

title: Second phase of auctioning Presidential Secretariat’s luxury vehicles commences
byline: The second phase of bidding has commenced for the sale of 27 luxury and decommissioned vehicles from the Presidential Secretariat, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Pakistan says Indian drone attacked soldiers, while air defences shot down 25 drones
byline: India fired attack drones into Pakistan on Thursday (May 8), with one wounding four soldiers, the Pakistani military said, a day after missiles struck several locations and killed more than two dozen people.
